The rise of electric vehicles has a significant impact on the oil industry. As more and more people switch to electric cars, the demand for gasoline and diesel fuel decreases, leading to an eventual decline in the demand for oil. Additionally, electric cars are becoming more affordable, making them a more attractive option for consumers who want to save money on gas and maintenance costs.

This reduced demand for oil has caused the price of crude oil to fluctuate as supply exceeds demand. This can lead to lower profits for oil companies and slower growth in the industry. Additionally, as more renewable energy sources become available, the demand for oil may continue to decrease.

To counteract this decline in demand, some oil companies are diversifying into other areas, such as renewable energy or electric vehicle charging infrastructure. Others are investing in new technologies that will allow them to extract oil more efficiently and cost-effectively. However, it remains to be seen how successful these efforts will be in the long term.
